newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - COPPER AND ALUMINIUM SEEN LOWER.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - COPPER AND ALUMINIUM SEEN LOWER.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Copper and aluminium prices look set to test lower levels following downside chart closes on Friday, traders and analysts said.
Copper may move to test key support at $2,270 a tonne, while if aluminium breaks below $1,700 prices are likely to tumble to $1,680, they added.
COPPER - Rising London Metal Exchange (LME) stocks may prompt copper to test support at $2,270 a tonne, traders and analysts said on Monday.
"With the technical indicators now resuming their fall a re-test of the recent lows around $2,270 is a possibility," LME broker Brandeis said.
Harry Creates of Amalgamated Metal Trading (AMT) said Friday's close suggested that a test of important support at $2,270 and possibly lower may emerge during Monday's trading.
Creates believed copper needed to close above $2,340 to relieve downside pressure.
At 0645 GMT three months LME copper was quoted at $2,301/06, versus Friday's late London close of $2,290/94.
ALUMINIUM - May test support towards $1,700 a tonne as the market continues to unwind its recent overbought condition.

Creates of AMT suggested prices may test $1,709, $1,700 and possibly $1,680 following Friday's bearish close. "On the upside a close above $1,749 is needed to relieve downward pressure and target $1,73 again," Creates said.
Traders will be eyeing June IPAI stocks data due later on Monday.
"The IPAI inventory figures are not likely to spring any big surprises as we look to the stock data to come in unchanged to slightly down," Martin Squires of Rudolf Wolff said.
At 0645 GMT three months aluminium was quoted at $1,738/42, against $1,728/32.
